data.title: Getting Here
data.text:
Newark Liberty International Airport (EWR)

Located in the City of Newark and offers a full range of domestic and international flights. Many Newark hotels offer complimentary shuttle service to/from Newark Airport, including Newark downtown hotels: Newark Liberty is recognized as the closes hotel to midtown Manhattan.

Air Train is free for on-airport travel and makes frequent stops around the airport including airline terminals, parking lots, hotel shuttle areas and rental car facilities. The Air Train will also take you to Airport Station which will connect you NJ TRANSIT, PATH and Amtrak. It takes about five minutes to get from Air Train to the train platforms and between seven and 11 minutes to get to your terminal, depending on the terminal. Monorail fare is included in Amtrak tickets to and from the Newark Airport Rail Station.

NJ TRANSIT

NJ TRANSIT is New Jersey's public transportation corporation. Its mission is to provide safe, reliable, convenient and cost-effective transit service with a skilled team of employees, dedicated to our customers' needs and committed to excellence.

NJ TRANSIT also administers several publicly funded transit programs for people with disabilities, senior citizens and people living in the state's rural areas who have no other means of transportation. In addition, the agency provides support and equipment to privately-owned contract bus carriers.

Click Here for all airfare and pricing.

Bus service: is available through NJ Transit Bus Lines go 28, 37, 62, 67, and 107.

Express Bus runs between Newark Liberty International Airport & New York City. The Express Bus runs from 4 a.m. until 2 a.m./ 365 days. The cost is $16 for one way, or

$28 for round trip.

Each bus stops at all 3 New York stops.
